timeline.bodyText: Let's say we have 2 clients with different config for the netty worker threads. If one client is already active, the 2nd client's thread config will be ignored, correct?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: Yes. Connection level properties should be consistent.
replies.author: ggezer

replies.bodyText: That behavior seems a little sketchy to me
replies.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: How about we bring singleton back for a subset of props?
replies.author: ggezer

replies.bodyText: I don't really see a good way to do this unless we make the # of threads unconfigurable/unbounded. Otherwise if we expose the configuration to users it will be kind of confusing. Either way, I think that is fine to work on in a later PR.
replies.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: Consistency level won't prevent an application in a client JVM writing FileSystem.Factory.create(conf) where the conf has two separate values for the netty threadpool
replies.author: ZacBlanco
